description: Chuck Lyon, a medical marijuana patient and grower does his part to conserve water by capturing 60,000 gallons of rainwater every year. (Photo by Brittan Jenkins | News21)
Kept within the bounds of a wire cage, Lyon's six legal marijuana plants grow outside until they are ready for harvest. (Photo by Brittan Jenkins | News21)
Inside a small plastic tube, Chuck Lyon stores a few marijuana seeds from his harvest. (Photo by Brittan Jenkins | News21)

Lyon's desk displays a collection of things that are important to him:  written thoughts on marijuana cultivation, a study on river depletion and hand-rolled tobacco cigarettes. (Photo by Dom DiFurio | News21)
Lyon and his dog, Beatle, go for a drive in his custom built Rat Chevy. (Photo by Brittan Jenkins | News21)
An abandoned trailer remains on the site of a tresspass grow just a few minutes from Lyon's house. It hasn't been touched in six years. (Photo by Brittan Jenkins | News21)
